headline: Justice Dept. Faults Its Tap of Trump Aide
abstract: The revelation was the latest to underscore the flaws in the F.B.I.’s surveillance of Carter Page.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Justice Department has conceded to a secretive intelligence court that the available evidence about Carter Page, a former Trump campaign adviser wiretapped by the F.B.I. during the Russia investigation, was legally insufficient to justify the last several months of his continued surveillance in 2017.
keywords: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
